contents: Opponents argue that the long-term stability of the gold standard has a cost: short-term stability. Historically, events such as the California Gold Rush (which resulted in a sudden increase of gold) and the Civil War (which destroyed infrastructure, making goods scarce) caused major inflation under the gold standard. According to historical data, price swings were greater under the gold standard. By limiting the ability of the government to manipulate the economy, the gold standards remove economic controls that help stabilize the economy and deal with recessions.
